snippet: Connecticut limits racial deviations in enrollment within school districts, and that has challenged a town with geographic divides in its population.
abstract: Leaders and many parents in the Greenwich, Conn, school district are challenging notion of state law that limits racial deviations in enrollment within school districts; Greenwich education officials are weighing several proposals for state review, even as they make the case that improving education might not be as simple as rebalancing schools' racial makeup.
lead_paragraph: Connecticut limits racial deviations in enrollment within school districts, and that has challenged a town with geographic divides in its population.

headline.main: Law on Racial Diversity Stirs Greenwich Schools
headline.print_headline: Town’s Schools Test a Law of Racial Arithmetic
